alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Caledonia, northeastern Orleans and northern Essex Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Charleston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Island Pond, Derby Center, Charleston, Canaan, Westmore, Derby Line Village, Ferdinand, Morgan, Warren Gore, Averys Gore, Holland, Brunswick, Bloomfield, Brighton, Norton, Averill, Warners Grant, Lewis, Newark, and Newark Hollow. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 174 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
